5jiySJkKHtX2RNK-_0fIEw.text: Kids choice night. They wanted Ramen. I suggested this place because according to their yelp, they serve Ramen. After our experience here, I think I've created little foodie monster children lol. They are so blunt and hey, kids keeps it real!  I had no influence in their opinions, yet I always encourage kindness. But my unfiltered 6 year old son and 3 year old daughter had the most funniest facial reactions to their "ramen".   "Mommy, the noodles are so hard." "Eww what kind of soup is this?" (Miso and shoyu base) "Mommy, you tricked us, you said they'd have Ramen."  "Can we never come back here again?"  I had to keep shushing them because other customers were looking our way. My husband tried their Ramen and agreed. My 11 year old son, however, enjoyed his grilled chicken wings. The other two little kiddos asked if they can have potstickers because they couldn't eat anymore soup. After encouraging them to eat more, I did order some potstickers, and my hungry little monsters gobbled up the two orders.  I enjoyed my salmon sashimi and plain rice onigiri. In fact, I had hubby pick some up for me to-go another night since the kids were so adamant about not wanting to eat here ever again lol.  3 stars for the good service we had, the grilled wings, potstickers, and salmon sashimi. Not a great choice for Ramen.

Lmodhs9gwwOm0yqfmULVuQ.text: I love this menu! There is always something to fix that japanese craving you have. I wish this place had a better rating, because I didn't come here for the longest time because of their rating wasn't high enough. But this is a 5 star inexpensive japanese restaurant with a great ramen, udon and soba menu. Their appetizer menu is also 2 pages and sometimes I just order off it.

photos.caption: Photo of Omoide Noodles & Bowls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So delicious and healthy!

It8qumyd7OE5iUZGtZMbdw.text: I came here for lunch yesterday since it's near work. It wasn't busy at all, but it wasn't empty either. It's easy to find as the name of the place is in big letters on the front of the building. Service was attentive and polite. I ordered the Tonkotsu bowl. Generous portion and the broth was excellent. I'm already looking forward to coming back and trying some other varieties.

9s-8wsh4_-lUCGHyjk1iUA.text: So there's this story about Lexus that goes something like this:  A few months after its launch, Lexus faced a potentially disastrous recall.  What could have been a major faux up actually helped to define a level of customer service people now closely associate with the luxury car company.  Our first visit to Omoide was kinda like that. Although it was laden with way too many silly mistakes for a super slow lunch (food delivered to wrong table, missing orders, etc.), their level of attentiveness and speed in fixing our orders thereafter saved them from a far far worse review . . . the food also helped out a little.  I had the spicy tonkotsu with extra chasu: good broth, decent amount of heat, okay noodles, and good chasu.  The wife had the veggie miso with extra corn: tasty veggie broth and a good amount of greens and things.  Now I'm not saying Omoide is anyway like the Lexus of ramen.  All I am hoping for is that the ramen stays tasty and that next time we go things will go more smoothly.

G6Cseb18sDUE6QBvpIAU-w.text: I was excited to hear that a ramen joint is near . The service is good but the time it took for my food to come out was ridiculous . You are better off eating ramen on spring mountain such as sora .

PU6HxG2J2gHB6V92N1oHPg.text: This place is Japanese food interpreted by Koreans I think. Not quite the same as ramen places in China town done by Japanese. Cool atmosphere but the food is lacking in something.

Bw0twIbuweSnEKhq0yTShg.text: Been looking for a legit spot for ramen and I can finally say "I FOUND IT!" Anything in the menu I highly recommend. I tried the Spicy Tonkatsu and it was AMAZING, the spice was on point! Like really on POINT! Was super spicy one sec then it's okay the next! To perfect to describe. Lol anyways!!!  The place is super nice, amazing staff, fun to look at and be at. Location is great Cuz I live on the same street lol. You will definitely see me here twice a week or more. Ramen is life bro.

Vj0tbV_KaRj00NVCGS1FYQ.text: Not only is this place close to our house but the place is so good. ramen is Delish, I always get the spicy miso and my kids love the bowls.

zGyl0pQvf-42drk5GdmO2w.text: Wanted to try a new ramen place and didn't know what expect. The service was absolutely terrible besides constantly getting water refills the wait time for a party of six to receive their order was way too long for having no one there but three other parties of two. The ramen was mediocre at best and it was a complete let down service wise. The girl servers couldn't give a ETA on how long more for our orders after waiting about 30 mins.

uIM38fV14UccglNJSC1hVw.text: I love this place! The tonkatsu is the best base in town so far. I love the spicy tonkatsu and the chashu is always excellent. I would highly recommend this place as because it is fantastic. I did take a friend there that doesn't do carbs, and they pretty much have nothing for non carb eaters. Just saying! However, great service and excellent food quality makes this place fantastic for my lunch spot.

HPsX9cbGx5dA-h0pmZGl4w.text: This ramen restaurant is located conveniently 2 blocks away from where I live. I went there out of curiosity and hunger and ordered the spicy tonkotsu shoyu ramen. It really blew me away how delicious it was. The broth had just the right amount of spice and the toppings were all amazing. The portion was enough for me to be full, but not uncomfortably stuffed. The staff is polite and the place was super clean. It's no monta, but it is still incredibly good.

gah8SxLyO1qtgTgo3b64Gw.text: Been here twice for lunch, and I just gotta say their lunch special deal is a STEAL! $12 for noodles, rice, and a drink!  On my first visit, I had the lunch special with tonkotsu shoyu ramen, curry bowl, and an iced green tea. The ramen was quite yummy: the noodles were cooked perfectly - not too soggy yet not too hard; the chashu had a lot of flavor; and I had a nice helping of green onions to go with it. I'm not really a fan of the big piece of seaweed in my ramen, so I didn't really care for it. The curry don was your normal japanese curry with rice; nothing too special. Finally, the iced green tea. Let's just say it was so watered down it seems like I was drinking green-colored water. At least it was free with the lunch special. Lol.  My second visit I had the shrimp tempura udon, the chashu don, and a hot green tea. Warning: don't expect to get the thick udon noodles you're used to. Think the  thinner dry instant udon noodles you can buy at the supermarket. Also, they literally dunk your shrimp tempura in the broth, so by the time it gets to the table, there is no crisp to the tempura anymore; just soggy tempura wrapped shrimp. I didn't really care for the udon. Next was the chashu don. The sauce of the chashu gets soaked into the rice and it just makes it SO much better. Let's just say the chashu don more than made up for the disappointing udon. I practically licked the bowl clean and wanted seconds! As for the hot green tea, let's just say I was letting it cool before drinking it. About 10 minutes later, the waitress came and switched it for a new steaming hot green tea! I was like, "Uh... I was waiting for it to cool before drinking it."... I guess +1 for above and beyond customer service? LOL!  I'll definitely be returning again just for the chashu don. :)

CE-cjCmFxybQUWwmeec2JA.text: Only the second place I found that served Katsu-don.  It came hot like I like it but there was no shiro (sauce) in the bottom for the rice so by the time I got under the pork cutlet it was very dry, hot, but very dry.  Very difficult grinding the rest of my order so I have to give only two stars.  Service was very good though.  Best Katsudon I've ever had was in 1968 in Vietnam during jungle down time.  Ate at this fabulous house owned by Thai's had a restaurant inside and catered to every body.  Can't beat there food next to Hwuang's, monkey brain, tiger soup, snake teriyake, etc.

d4p17Yj9vAQbMt7AZ8TaYQ.text: A new ramen place in town & close to my work so had to check it out over lunch one Friday. Only about 4 other diners in the venue upon arrival around 1:15pm. And it wasn't an extraordinarily hot day. Music was too loud we had to ask them to turn it down so we didn't have to shout at each other. They obliged. Ordered the traditional Tonkotsu. It was good even though I put way too much chili oil in it. The server was extremely nice & gave me more broth to add to my bowl because there was no way I could eat it that spicy. I think I like Monta Chaya a bit better. But it's nice to have a ramen place on the SW side of town now & in the winter months that's where I'll be for lunch from time to time.

SmNdmWt1oWKzUwTRg_nwtg.text: I love Asian food and saw this place when I moved to this side of town. The food was meh and BLAND RAMEN!!! But I guess I'll give it another shot.

aaGroJR8724EIRTWhOHI_w.text: I went here a few days ago and tried there spicy ramen since that's what I usually always get when I go for ramen. After taking my first sip I noticed that their miso is watered down, there are many other places I've gone too that I feel are way more creamier, I even added butter and corn and usually when I do that it just becomes creamer at other ramen spots. Also, the noodles weren't my favorite. I felt like this place wasn't as authentic than other ones I've been to. all in all it wasn't bad but being that I've been to other places that I feel are better in my opinion made me compare. But on the plus side the service here was great, everyone was real nice and explained everything well.

07rA_yqlKvtFZoCZDni7GA.text: Nice place. But never had Japanese food before. It would be very helpful if they had English speaking waitresses there.  Because I need an explanation what the food is, what kind of meat, how is it prepared. It's very hard to pick something off the menu when u do Not get a good explanation.  Maybe I got the only non english speaking one.

TN9-p4xY9v8T-_LBIddMIA.text: First time here tonight. I heard so much good things about this place. My experience was not great and neither was the experience of my companions - there was a foul sewer smell filtering in inside of the restaurant and we waited what seemed like forever for our ramen soups (it had to be around 30 mins or more) do not worth the wait - not as flavorful as I have had at other ramen joints. When we asked why it's taking so long, the servers said they are backed up in the kitchen which there were only two- three tables of 2-3 people. The rice bowls two our companions ordered came out in decent time. One a good thing was the salmon sashimi was fresh. Unfortunately I will not be dining here again!!!!

23d6lU-e-SVRu56E-tUcZQ.text: The flavor of this place is my favorite out of all of the ramen joints in town. However, the waitresses do not write your order down so our waitress had to come back to our table twice and ask for clarification. My food still came out wrong but luckily I'm not super picky so I didn't send it back. The waitresses really need to use pen and paper to take orders so that there aren't any wrong orders that may result in a waste of food.

n9eoNMsqaHNgPNrTZDS6LQ.text: Great place for a quick ramen fix. Good atmosphere, delightful. There's one waitress that always remembers us and they have great service.

txTqeCknel14GBe8vN281Q.text: My wife and I came here  for a later dinner on a Friday night. This place would get minus stars if Yelp would allow it. We walked in and were seated quickly but everything went downhill from here. It took a few minutes just to be acknowledged and drink orders taken. I ordered a udon bowl and the wifey ordered a donkatsu plate. After waiting an eternity my food finally came out first. It didn't just taste like instant udon but I think this is what they were really serving. Flavorless, soggy shrimp tempura, and one small fish cake. I finished my food and my wife never got hers. I asked the waitress if her food was on its way and she apologized and said she would check on it. She didn't give us an update and came back 10 minutes later with the food. When we were done it was another unacceptable wait to request and receive the check. It was a crappy experience overall and we won't be back to this place.

dCLu-NxEKwAa31gGNmzInw.text: Fantastic place! My first time dining there the staff was very friendly and explained the items on the menu that I wasn't sure of (it all sounds good). The portions are big for the prices that other companies would charge a pretty penny for. Even when I couldn't take another bite I wanted to just keep eating the taste was so unique.

XFpMVLkvYUICSuTxEVqZQw.text: I have been waiting for a place like this near my house!! Service is great and the food is even better. I tried the kaarage, gyoza, and spicy tonkatsu ramen. I definitely recommend this place!

Vs6RYUDuc1AiczFMre-z8g.text: We were debating over a few places and we're driving by on Veterans Day Monday before stopping here. I had read the mixed reviews but decided some hot soup and noodles would hit the spot on this chilly day. My husband wanted to take it to go, but when I tried to order the lunch special, she said it was for dine in only. So instead, I ordered the Tonkatsu Shoyu Ramen and Mini Charsui Bowl for the same price (sans the drink). We were told it would be 10 minutes. That was at 12:07pm. A few people who had come in after us had gotten food, and every time they would walk by, their eyes would glaze right past us, not realizing we had been sitting there while others were getting served. At 12:27 I asked the girl go check on our order as it had been 20 minutes which they said it would be 10. They went to the kitchen and mumbled something and said they were packing it up and we would be next. 12:38. We got our food at 12:38. A mini apology but nothing to assuage the situation or make amends. That was my first disappointment. This food had better make up for the poor service we had already received. I poured the noodles and such into a giant bowl and poured the soup over it. I figured after a little time the noodles would soften and I would have a beautiful, aromatic, meal to make my mouth and stomach happy. To my chagrin the noodles stayed in the shape of the styrofoam they had packed it in. I had to microwave the whole thing to get it to loosen up. Even then, it was...well meh. Nothing horrible but definitely not worth waiting 30 minutes for. The mini charsiu bowl, on the other hand, was delightful. It was packed full of flavor and the meat was tender and melted in my mouth.  However, overall, it was a meal meant to be forgotten. While I shall not forget the Veterans who served and thus gave me a day off of work, I shall easily forget this lackluster meal I regrettably paid for.

1zjKlY1zXdnBswNObRlJQQ.text: Visited Omoide yesterday.  I really wanted fried rice and an eggs but because it was lunch and I didn't want to much food as I would with the Hawaiian plate lunch places, I decided on Omoide.    During this visit, I got the shrimp tempura don, the closest I was going to get to fried rice and eggs.  The order was $12.  However, I learned that it comes with miso soup and salad.  Customer service was great.  Restaurant was clean and appealing - lots to look at.  I thought it was really tasty and looking forward to my next visit.

_GCa8epFepIIZl8huazb1w.text: This is a hidden gem in south west Las Vegas. It has great udon and soba for a local Japanese establishment. They also have this nifty 30$ king pork cutlet (tonkatsu).  If you finish it in twenty minutes the meal is free and you also Get a t shirt. My husband tried this challenge and epically failed! It's basically three times the size of the pork cutlet and a heaping bowl of rice and salad!! Try at your own risk!  They also have the regular 15$ version which is a smaller version but still fairly big.  Check it out, in a cold day a hot pot of udon is a perfect meal

yvuScvcJV6Kzqsnoa0Qz0g.text: Seems like they changed up the interior since the last time I came here. They have booths now on the left side of the entrance!   If you're a newbie to Omoide, and have a craving for curry late at night, definitely try their ton katsu curry don. The pork cutlets melt in your mouth! A delicious surprise for me as it reminded me of a closed establishment years ago that had a similar dish (however I couldn't find any place that served it anywhere in Vegas for the life of me). Not until stepping into this quaint little joint.   Ton Katsu Curry Don consists of a generous amount of pork cutlets, white rice that consistently doesn't get too sticky or hard in texture, slices of red ginger, and a less than wholesome amount of curry sauce all over. It always comes with a soup and salad, whether you order dine in or to go.    Apparently they have tonkotsu ramen with black garlic oil (but only limited to one specific ramen), which I tried briefly with a few friends however flavorful it may be, it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Their late night Japanese beer specials are definitely noteworthy though!

Mx_dlV4XBmIJxp-CGqmuVA.text: I absolutely love this place! My friends and I went here during the last day of school to celebrate and it was worth it! I'm not sure why but after my trip to Japan, I had a really bad craving for Japanese food! This place met all my cravings and I highly recommend this place for Japanese food!!

waJcwgK2kjlcjIYuau-zrw.text: We had a less than stellar experience here.  After a long day of work, we stopped by Omoide for some food and drink.  We ordered a beef tataki, hot sake, and two bowls of Tonkotsu.    Oddly, our tonkotsu came out before our sake and appetizer... but no big deal.  We then had to ask twice for at least the hot sake to come out.  When the sake finally came out, we then had to ask for our appetizer.    When our beef tataki finally came out, it was nothing like the pictures.  We received some thick sliced COOKED beef.  Tataki is supposed to be thin sliced raw beef.  We had asked our server about it and she simply said that it's always cooked to medium, shrugged, and then left.  I don't think that she even sensed that we were dissatisfied about the plate that we received.   Oh well.

photos.caption: Photo of Omoide Noodles & Bowls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Floating lanterns!

eF4ikhuhr5fmj0P-zCSaGQ.text: For the past six months, I have heard nothing but excellent things about this restaurant from my best friend, so we came here with high expectations. It is suffice to say that our expectations were exceeded!   Despite the fact that it was a Sunday afternoon, there were plenty of open seats. Upon walking in, we were immediately greeted and assigned to a seat. The menu holds so many options, whether you're feeling ramen or Japanese curry or appetizers or cold noodles. Its wide variety made me question my decision because everything looked so good (and I wasn't even hungry).   The pricing is ridiculously good. Although we only ordered two mini dishes and an appetizer, we were filled up and the total ended up being lower than a fast food meal. There's no chicken option for the curry so I opted for a mini chicken curry bowl. It's pretty good sized and it was only $4! My boyfriend ordered the chasu bowl and a karage and was super satisfied with his meal as well.   Our waiter was super attentive and knowledgeable too. He continuously checked up on us and filled out water cups. It's definitely a win-win when the service and food quality mirrors one another! To top of it off, there's a great ambiance and I would highly recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner! We definitely see ourselves returning in the near future.

c_p9W9S77sm_bLPLvWHsHg.text: I felt so sick after eating the food here with my family and the service was terrible!!!!! They didn't greet us or approached when we were in the restaurant, we were standing there for good 10 minutes without any questions like how many people in our group or how long is the wait .... nothing. And we were eating the servers weren't attentive never came to refill our water.  Worst service!!!!!!!! Food came out soooo late! Never going back!  I think the management doesn't care about the terrible services in this restaurant!

KknNhjEz7u4LSgNuShVdzg.text: OMG!  New favorite nearby restaurant!    Having driven by it many times, GMonkey finally try. And return 3 more times with more friends to see if I'm not only one who loves this place. We all love it!  Outside is a crowded strip mall, inside is an escape. Dark wooden raised booths, multiple floor table seating for both small and larger groups, super friendly staff every time and food is great!  Lunch specials are perfect.   GMonkey do:  TONKOTSU Combo- ramen, mini chashu, salad, soda = $12 TONKOTSU Combo- ramen, mini curry, salad, soda = $12 KING TONKATSU CHALLENGE- 3 Gigantic slabs as big as large oval plate, ramen bowl of rice & miso soup-sized bowl of sauce(asked for aside). Finish all in 20mins = FREE!  Do try a regular-sized plate. It's still of generous sized meat, rice and salad!    Losers to challenge (like me), pay $30 for lunch and dinner for next 3 days. Though I may not order Tonkatsu for next few weeks, it is still one of best we've ever had. Crunchy, lean, hot, thick slabs of meat, breaded and fried to perfection!    Ramen is delicious on its own, but paired with a mini bowl of another entree you may be curious about + salad + drink for $12!  What a deal!  Cannot  wait til next visit to try other items.   GMonkey want eat entire menu!

ojcgoN0vUscA5nYKIlIzAQ.text: Rating is not for the food. I recommend you try it for yourself. If I came back, I would not order the same thing.  Miso soup- it had a smoke wood almost burnt taste to it. Corn cheese- very different,  not a pleasant different, more like I would not order it again. Toss salad was ok Charsui bun- I would not order again Don't get me wrong, I am not saying it's bad. The flavors were just not to my liking.  Food presentation was great.  Outside- very clean, strip mall, lots of parking. Lots of light  Inside-small, cute,  I don't like the chairs. Lanterns hanging down are nice, inside decor is nice Service-good Prices- good Over all, I don't think I would come back. But this place seems like if you have the taste buds for this place then it would be rock'n. The food just made me miss all the great food at home (Hawaii)

_hqrjhd_83S6hvl_f-cN9A.text: For 2 years now I have been taking my family here pretty much every week, sometimes twice a week. In recent weeks they started playing explicit music. As I look around the restaurant this very moment I count 14 children eating here and the loud music keeps dropping f-bombs over and over. I kindly asked if they would skip the track but they wouldn't. Same story last week. Is it really that important to management to have profanity playing in the restaurant during lunch time when families are here? I get it if it's the late night or happy hour crowd, but during the day I don't see why they can't play the same songs with the profanity taken out. So this will be our last visit as a family. Pretty bummed.

Dkt8aRqNi6NcbAPHCkg55A.text: New chef? New Management? This couldn't possibly be the same place we used to rely on for tasty food and great service. After reading a previous yelper recommend the sauteed mushrooms, I had to give them a try. Disappointing would be an understatement... They were doused in a whole stick of butter - completely inedible! We had to send them back.  When our server presented our check he apologized for the mushrooms and offered Mochi ice cream "on the house." While we appreciated the gesture, what we didn't understand is why he wouldn't remove the mushrooms from our check. Why would we pay for something we were unable to eat!? 2 stars because the Tofu steak was quite good and I'm hoping this was just an "off" night. But, I'm still going to have a difficult time convincing my husband to return.

Nam6Lprvl3NPEv5eUYdGCA.text: Omoide is one of those restaurants that makes you feel like you're in Japan without trying hard to be Japanese. I was a little suspect upon first walking in, as the outside looks like it could be a fast food place with a drive through, however was pleasantly surprised upon entering; It was a casual sit down restaurant.  The Service and is wonderful and the place was decorated nicely! My friend and I had the tonkatsu curry don, chicken karaage don and the potato korokke . They were good, not stand out fantastic, but got the job done.  Best part was the happy hour special they had, where the Sake was buy one get one free.    Overall, I'd come back to try something else on the menu, but mostly because the service was fantastic.   Yay, Omoide! I'll be back...

JAHfnC-oIs7sDgub72u5NQ.text: In Vegas Ramen scene Omoide Noodles & Bowls falls short of the competition. I just feel the Ramen is ok at best nothing spectacular, jaw dropping, and memorable. I ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen with my lunch special. The broth for me just lacked flavor or any kind or depth. My normal go to spots the Tonkatsu Ramen feel more heavier broth unlike one here is water down and lacked any kind of depth or distinct flavor. The toppings get nice amount like any other Ramen spot in Vegas. Ramen it starts and ends with the broth. Unfortunately did not work for me. Next time I will try order Shoyu broth. The Curry Bowl that was five star experience!! It Japanese style brown curry. Right off the back my favorite style curry. It delivered on point! I just wished ordered bigger bowl. =( I love the fact even for side dish for the lunch special not skimpy came to the portion size. The curry has nice amount of chicken and vegetables in it. The house salad that came with the lunch special was good. I enjoyed the vinaigrette style dressing on it. LUNCH special talk about steal of deal. $12 there no way can go wrong in life. Bowl of noodles, choice side, and drink plus house salad. I know plan on coming back again just for the lunch special and more curry bowl action.  The decor is pretty cool. Thinking for small restaurant off the strip in tiny strip shopping mall Omoide had tons tons of personality. Right from the moment you walk in with the Ramen Bar set up if by yourself great spot get your noodles on. The cool lights and the Japanese advertisement with everything in Japanese. Definitely nothing like you would think from the outside. The service was five star they were awesome explaining everything being first timer and going over the lunch special cause talk about options. Not just lunch specials the regular menu has nice diversity.

PRICES Considering that a bowl of ramen is already $7.50 to $10, I feel that the toppings such as egg ($1.50) and cha shu ($3) should be included. In the end, I feel that the menu is on the pricier side.   CUSTOMER SERVICE My waitress was friendly. Checked on me frequently even though I didn't need anything.   ENVIRONMENT Cute decor. They have late night happy hour so it seems like this place can be loud and lively.   Overall, I wouldn't return. I'm sure I can find better tasting ramen out here in Vegas.

xYck6tGy9ChS39dS0iLrjQ.text: The food was decent. Dining area was pretty clean. That's the only reason I'm giving this review a two star. The roaring music the employees play are explicit and very offensive. The kind one should be listening using a headset or played at a rave party. Not a place to take children, family, aunts, uncle, grandparents, or even discuss respectable business. Regardless if a restaurant is $ or $$$$, background music should not be inappropriate. The content of lyrics played during a late lunch with my 12 yr olds twins were obscene, indecent and profane. The owner should have a sign on the door about their inappropriate music so children or anyone  who wishes not to be an audience to this type of surrounding can opt out. This place seem to be overpowered by a group of young careless inadequate staff. Is it recommendable? I wouldn't put my name recommending this place, there plenty ramen places that are worth earning your business like Ramen Kobo on Durango/215.

qNwbiDx7Ai8RGVvwIVvbHA.text: Cute exterior menu board and interior decor, so I really wanted to like this place! It's trying to be what people expect Tokyo to be like, but just an FYI, it's not actually...which would totally be ok if the authenticity in flavors was there... The menu had good options, but I'm afraid our lunch didn't live up to my expectations. The karaage wasn't seasoned enough - there needs to be more salt and maybe a crispier batter (higher cooking temp fryer so it's crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside), and if we're trying to avoid over salting, there should be condiments on the side (salt and pepper) on the table, but there wasn't...or at least offered on the side (there was curry powder and a mayo/soy sauce on the side instead...maybe chili pepper could've been an option?). The onigiri fell short also, the rice was overcooked (wet), and the ume filling was ok - but for the price I wouldn't typically point this out as a fault except that the rest of the meal wasn't that tasty either. Then my miso ramen - it wasn't hot (maybe the bowls should be warmed prior to serving? Because it was room temp when it got to the table), the ramen noodle was different, and slightly overcooked. The miso base itself was rather bland and more orange in color than I typically have, so maybe it was a different miso base?  Overall everything was ok, and the best way to explain it is that all the flavors are mild. Other notes - it bothered me that multiple tables brought on outside drinks, and no one said anything (as in, 1 table had Starbucks, another had raising canes, but maybe it's just that casual?)...and when our apps came out, there were no utensils/napkins/plates? We had to wait for each of our entrees to come out for them to bring each setting (since mine came out first, I had chopsticks, but my companion had to wait for their ramen to eat the app!). Finally, no one stopped by to touch our table (server or manager) to see how we were doing until I was waiting for a check and the server saw how my ramen was not touched much, as I just didn't care for it any more than an instant ramen I can make at home. If you're in the area and want a quick bite/fast food, this may definitely be the place for you! But I think you're might be better off going to Chinatown for a better meal at the same price, and if you like stronger flavors/temperature-appropriate meals.

FTZAXRHVmZW9VqLDdUNH-Q.text: If you are interested in getting the steak don bowl, do not bother. It is dry and flavorless steak. You can spend $12 on better food elsewhere.  The service was okay. NuPL5dEq-ylOK4fo7D4Hkg.text: Omoide Noodles and Bowls is a nice little Japanese noodle house, with attractive Japanese decor, and very tasty food.  I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu lunch special, with an order of Gyoza, and a iced green tea.  The bowl was amazing!  The mushroomy broth was so good I drank out of the bowl what I couldn't get with the spoon.  The ramen was cooked perfectly, and the little mushrooms were very good as well.  The Pork Chashu bowl on the side was a very pleasant surprise, and was bursting with flavor.  It was like little slices of pork belly that fall apart in your mouth with a gingery soy flavor, which seeps through to the rice underneath.  The little salad that came with the dish was light and tasty as well.  Speaking to the customer service, I ordered a second lunch combo for my son who was going to meet me there, and because my son was late, the staff was kind enough to offer to make a new dish for him so that it would be nice and hot when he arrived, which was very much appreciated.  I will DEFINITELY recommend Omoide to friends, and I will also be back again soon.

BGU_SMm5-M3FDL7rzXceXw.text: Great food and great service. Couldn't ask for anything more. We will be back soon. Loved there spicy miso ramen and beef was great.

u8jbpzvU45ssSgULSjw7gA.text: when it first opened, it used to be so good, everything used to be so perfect, but WHAT HAD HAPPENED? they have made some really poor choice over last couple of time I went there.   1. We got disappointed on our favorite karaage chicken, it used to be very lightly fried with thin breading skin, chicken itself isn't salty at all, but still tasty, right now they claimed they used some new thick breading outside of chicken, it's also super salty, I do not like it at all, I cannot believe someone pass this decision, it was the most horrible decision they've ever made.  2. after being disappointed by karaage chicken, we have to find something else now..so we gave their pork bun a try.....it's good, except the pork I got in my pork bun was literally PAPER THIN with mostly breading and almost no meat, I'm not joking guys, I compare my pork meat with the picture on their menu, which looks just like a generous thick cut, it looks NOTHING like it at all, when I talked to waitress they just politely apologize, although I didn't expect them to give me money back....but...not even effort of remaking me a new one? wow, there goes another star  after these 2 times....I'm sad to say that they have loose two loyal customer(more customers, because I will not recommend my friend to go there anymore).  Good bye omoide, time to go back to good old Sora and Monta :(

fuSEwQaz50FTe8CKaMzy0A.text: I finally got to try this place out last night. When I walked in, the decor was very cute - very japan lol I instantly realized that this was where rice trax used to be. Anyways, we were instantly greeted with a smile and got a table in the corner like we wanted. The menu is very simple. There were some things on the menu that I needed a translator for. The waitress kindly and patiently told us what we wanted to know. We opted for the rice ball things - one with beef in it and the other with crab in it. Both very good and remind me of Korea - the triangular rice ball? that you eat on the train or bus, sam kak kim bab lol We also got the potato croquettes - oh my gosh sooo goooood. I love potatoes and these croquettes were plump, hot, and oh so potatoey! For the noodle selection, I got the tonkatsu miso ramen and the boofran got tonkatsu shoyu ramen. They were both good but I think I prefer the flavor and broth at Jinya better. I would definitely come back again though, the appetizers are hella good. They also have don bowls or whatever that I would like to try next time.

jxK3XTIySkK63lU6ib_EiA.text: Food was delicious. I ordered a Katsu curry & wanted to add a side of corn. Technically you're not suppose to do that because the owner is very traditional Japanese and doesn't like to mess with how the food it actually suppose to taste but since my boyfriend ordered ramen the server just added the side of corn to his order. I liked the fact that it's a both ramen & also rice bowl kind of place. On top of that it's on the SW side of town. So much more convenient than driving across town. Our server was very attentive & the restaurant look very traditional & clean. I also found out through our server that omoide means dreams / memories. I like that!

Other then that The food is amazing and the place is clean. 3 stars though.. would've been 5 for sure.

0IOCOg94Zxh_j8J-F2e7PQ.text: You lost a regular customer because of bad management.  This was one of my favorite restaurants for I used to eat here 2-3 times per week.   So one night I put in a to-go order and the curry from the tonkatsu curry don was forgotten.   People make mistakes and this happens, nevertheless what happens next is the reason why I will never go back.   I did not call up the restaurant for I was not going to go back after a long day at work but I called 2 days later and told the girl who took the new order over the phone what had happened.   She apologized and this was not her fault for she was not there when it happened.  But her actions is what loses me as a customer forever.   I show up to the restaurant for my new order and I ask her can I speak to the manager and she says that is she.  She then tells me that she does not see any notes about it.   I told her over the phone that I did not call it in that night for I was not going to come back to the restaurant for the curry after a long day.   She then says that she can double check the order to see that the curry is there this time or give me extra curry.   ARE YOU KIDDING ME?   First of all, you don't trust me enough to give me the $12 tonkatsu curry don and if you are the manager, you should easily be able to give me the credit for it.   Keep your good food, but your handling of the situation is what lost me forever.  Very very sad and angry on how this was handled.   My 2-3x a week eating here is by no means of an exageration either.

bkkZeBZuWJgQs2TJ9djU_g.text: I didn't listen when people said the soup was bland, and now I learned my lesson... The soup is indeed  bland.. As well as their fried rice. And their little salad was dressed with soy sauce. Karaage was the only thing edible but in an incredibly tiny portion for the price. It was a four course disappointment lol. But hey the service was great. And the jelly sake was delicious, even though it was $8 for a can smaller than a can of soda. And the interior of the restaurant was gorgeous.   Would I return? NnnoooOOooo

RtOygbopvdZRFWSnN7SFdA.text: This is my favorite restaurant by far in Las Vegas. I am a fairly picky eater and I love small plates (Tapas) because I enjoy variety when I go out. The problem is at most places their small plates are very expensive. Here they are not only affordable but delicious. My husband and I  got a small rice plate with tuna, gyoza, onigiri, a pork bun and the spicy tonkatsu ramen. All were top par. Amazing!

Nj3qpDBOD5u83qWrtr5Qxw.text: Update: Second time around...much better! Seated quickly, food came out fast and service was great!  I tried their udon instead of the ramen (which I had last time) and I prefer the udon. The broth is better and the noodles aren't the thick udon noodles I've had at sushi and other Japanese restaurants. I like that you can add extras like wakame and fishcake (or tempura among other things).  I'm also a fan of the umeboshi nigiri, which if you're from Hawaii is basically a musubi with ume in it. I don't see this on a lot of menus and although it's a very simple item, I love it! Probably because it reminds me of home.  I'm glad I gave this place another chance. It was worth it!

Ys4eK0hc22pDGOHgX4ndIw.text: Bad service ever! I love this place, I love their food, always good service, but today was horrible! the server who are working opening sheet today, she was so rude! why she shift responsibility on the customer? she keep charge for her mistake even we said several time when we placed an order. she seems she don't have any knowledge about menu and common sense at all!  I asked to my husband to call them to make an order and pick up. He keep saying Not a ton katsu-don, we want to only ton katsu! but she can't understand. I thought she barely understand English.  Anyway when my husband pick the order, she give him donkatsu-don, so my husband explain about we want donkatsu, not a donkatsu-don. and guess what she saying? "Next time say order king tonkatus".  and we have to pay for tonkatsu-don too. It was her mistake I can't still understand why we have to pay for their mistake? and why this restaurant owner hire that kind of stupid server? If she are under training that the reason why she don't know about all the menu, they need to put another one to teach her.

n7hsPk0LCJ9tIWYYHToOSA.text: Sadly the quality has gone down. The veggies haven't been fresh and the service isn't improving. Quite a bummer as I was hoping things had improved since.

kU5VNvV0Yq6EVAhEOrA7FQ.text: Cute little Ramen place recommended by a local and frequent customer.  It was 2pm and restaurant wasn't too crowded and we got seated right away.  I would've given 5 stars if it wasn't for me asking if we can order and requesting for water three times.  After getting seated, we looked through the menu and waited.  About 10 mins go by, so I asked the female server who was cleaning the table if we can order and she asked to give her a second.  Okay, I'm fine with a second.  Well there were two servers cleaning the table.  We didn't even get water served yet and I was hella thirsty.  As I ordered, I asked for water.  The 1st female server brought me my tea and Ramune, but no water .  Asked the 2nd female server for water and she brings me one glass.  Had to ask for a another glass for my son.  The only male server was the only attentive one and noticed how rude the other servers were and apologized multiple times .  In the opposite end, the food was yummy.  Ramen broth was very flavorful.  The gyu don was the perfect taste- not too salty and it even came with a small salad and miso soup which was not indicated on the menu.

SRqmgrnGIvOQg04Z-jvl1w.text: First of all, parking here is atrocious. By some miracle, we managed to snag the weirdly singled out spot right in front of the entrance. Inside, the decor is beautiful and warm. It reminds me a lot of Japanese summer night festivals. We were seated in a booth tucked away in the corner.  The menu is pretty vast. Lots of options for udon, ramen, and various rice bowls. They also seem to have a decent alcohol selection. I ended up ordering the katsudon which is deep-fried pork cutlet with eggs and a sweet soy sauce over rice. My boyfriend ordered the curry tonkatsu don.   It took a bit of time before the server got to us even though the restaurant was pretty empty and there were several servers on the floor, but he was nice. The food was good, but not particularly memorable. The curry lacks the flare of Curry Zen and the tonkatsu was a bit dry. I loved the presentation though. Our meals came with miso soup, a side salad, and some pickled vegetables.   I'd come back, but I'd probably try something else like ramen.

Z2aY1gxfiSoj2RIT-GDzcg.text: We finally stopped and tried this place today. I wish I would have stopped here earlier. The food was very good. We tried a few dishes. We had the ebi katsu bowl, pork katsu, and the spicy short rib ramen.  Everything was good. We ordered our food to go and it was very quick. My favorite was the ramen. I will definitely order it again. We saw they had a spicy tonkatsu ramen and we might try it next time. I wonder if it is the same broth as the short rib. The broth was soooo good.

glh1EPnz7URzV9-pPrXMVw.text: I have come to Omoide a few times and their service has been great! It was really busy today, with a big party as well, so I can understand if circumstances are different.  When we walked into the restaurant & left, we weren't greeted at all. I thought it was a bit weird, but I figured it was because everyone was occupied.   We had enough time to look through the menu and order what food we wanted, along with our drinks. We were able to get our appetizers in a timely manner, but all of our food items were given as soon as they were sent out. So I would get my appetizer before my hubby's and he would get his meal before mine. I do understand the urgency, but I suppose I'm just used to getting all of our food at once and together.   Regardless, their food never disappoints. I am a big fan of their ramen and can't get over it! I enjoyed my meal overall. I will be coming back to see if there service was different because of the big party today.

J1IJTZdxEpw2XoAdTALL4A.text: Oh-Mo-E-De? So the name is interesting but the food is just A-OK. Came on a Sunday evening and the place was half-packed and became crowded as we were leaving after our meal. Parking is convenient in the plaza. The menu is pretty expansive with ramen, udon, soba, rice, and other apps that you can nibble on.  The Katsu-Don seemed to be the most popular since it took up half the page in the menu. It is a pork katsu fried with eggs and onions with a sweet sauce throughout the meat and the rice. The katsu was fried well and the meat wasn't dry. The eggs and onions had a good balance of sweet and savory. Overall, a hefty meal for $12. (Also came with a side salad, miso soup, and a couple pickled veges.  I didn't get to try the other dishes but I feel this place benefits from its variety of dishes you can choose from. The flavor is good but it's not extraordinary and a must have. That said, I would still come back for a decent meal even though I'd hope to get better service next time since the servers were a bit slow and even forgot us a couple of times.

The food has gotten a lot better from the time I ate there when it just opened.    I got the cold soba Ten Iso (tempura) noodle.  I craved something savory and cold to beat his summer heat.  Also ordered the crab, beef and plum onigiri (rice balls) and the grilled squid.  None disappointed.  Highly suggest the crab mix onigiri to you guys and definitely the cold soba.

UtUYlkcMZ9ebKwI9Iv8qzg.text: This was probably one of my least favorite ramens in Vegas. I came here because jinya was closed and was so sad after eating here.  The noodles taste so generic, like they came out of a pouch and not handmade, and the broth was so basic.  I got the veggie ramen btw.  Not much tofu and it wasn't really satisfying in taste.

nXCNClKSB4vrLk8sdWwRWw.text: No longer do you have to drive the treacherous roads of Chinatown to enjoy a bowl of hot ramen or rice bowl. This new Japanese-style noodle and rice bowl place is near Rainbow and the 215.   Omoide definitely has a home-y feel to it. It looks cool from the outside, and the interior looks even better. Japanese decorations adorn the wall and the lighting is a bit dim, but perfect to enjoy dinner with company. It sort of makes me think of a modern day version of a noodle house. Everything is clean and organized, and workers had a smile on their faces. Menus are presented in an unconventional clipboard and paper combination.  The waiter we had was friendly and he didn't seem to mind to educate us on the menu items. He also made sure our glasses were never empty and brought us a glass of ice to put in our drinks.  The music playing went along with the environment of the place, which was very pleasing to experience.   We ordered the chicken karaage don and the beef steak don. The beef steak don was cooked to your choice of temperature, but the taste of it with the ginger sauce (I think) was a bit weird. The chicken karaage was better tasting and was a bigger portion. Miso soup was on point and the salad tasted amazing even though it looked a little plain.   If you do decide to get dessert after eating, try the black sesame ice cream. It has a nutty flavor, yet a subtle sweetness to make it a perfect combination of flavors after eating a filling, well-portioned meal here.   Comment cards were offered to us after the meal because they wanted to see how they were doing since they're a new business in town.

PgxEGMa_EFdJGS-vs8nY2g.text: I am fairly impressed with Omoide! Thank you to Charity for posting pics of the menu. I saw that this place just opened and what better time to try it then on a cold Saturday May night. I made my husband pick it up and he was excited that he could stop by Lee's if he wasn't in the mood for noodles.   They just opened yesterday and when we called the first time there was no answer but they finally answered and we were able to order. My tonkatsu shoyu was more tonkatsu than shoyu but it was creamy and flavorful. I'm a bit thirsty after it but I assume it's just from the saltiness? The noodles were precooked in the to go box which could be a good thing or bad thing. They should probably offer an option of doing either or. Luckily the noodles were cooked al dente so when the noodles and soup were combined it wasn't a bunch of soggy noodles. The bamboo pieces were hard to eat but I definitely like the charsui. The onigri was ok. Nothing to go crazy about but it's a nice filler.   Overall, I'm glad they are opening more places around the southwest so we don't have to make the trek down to Chinatown. I'm definitely coming back when I feel the need to eat ramen. =)

N7JLwnGjdiSHEEhpSKiPHg.text: Only downside is they don't speak Japanese. But the food here is amazing and very ethentic. I ordered a crabmix onigiri. It came out hot. It was good, but I do perfer my onigiri at room temperature or slightly chilled like you can get in Japan. The Karage was delicious. Almost like KFC only high quality. The tempura was nice and lightly battered as well.  For a main entree I got the spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. Yum! I'm going to say its on par with Monta. The chirashi was thicker then normal though. But still soft.   My husband got Tonkutsu Curry.  It was delicious, although I wish there was a spicy option for it.   Will be back!!

xWMv8NKYYxl7akkHPJ9ikQ.text: Recently opened, this restaurant is located in Southwest side of Vegas. As the name of the restaurant "Omoide Noodles & Bowls" says, their menu mainly consist of noodles (choice of udon/soba in either hot/cold) and bowls with few appetizers.   ATMOSPHERE The atmosphere of this place itself deserves 5 stars. The interior resembles a lot like Omoide Yokocho in Sinjuku or Dotonburi Yokocho in Osaka. Just like the name "Omoide" which means memories, I was having a nostalgic moment as soon as I walked in. Aw, I would just come here just to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.  SERVICE Quick, attentive and friendly. Servers here were all smiling and were quick to refill water/constantly asking if we are doing ok.   FOOD I was craving some cold noodles and went with Shio Buta Bukkake. I went with Udon instead of soba. Food arrived within 10 mins. I looked at my bowl and was surprised at how simple it looked. Udon in tsuyu, with green onions and few pieces of shio buta on the side.   The soup, or tsuyu was on the saltier side but overall had a lot of flavor even though it looked so simple. I realized halfway that there were some yuzu kosho (seasoning made of yuzu peel, pepper and salt. Citrusy and refreshing) on the shio buta. If you get the Shio Buta Bukkake, then I advise you to mix the green onions and yuzu kosho together. Makes it more flavorful! As much as I loved this, portion was small and soup was too salty for my taste.   In addition to the bowl of noodle, I also ordered tempura mix. Mmh..for $6, definitely not worth it. Unless you are craving tempura, I would not order this. Few pieces of shrimp, along with vegetable tempura. It was just ok.   CONCLUSION Would like to see more options on the menu. I would like to see tsukemen added to the menu since they mainly serve noodles and rice bowls, but just a suggestion. Will return again!

EhQEWK8gQ5hk2Ie8GbCYzA.text: Gave this place a try and I was not disappointed. Their food is delicious and came out quickly. It's a great place to come when you're on a budget or your want to splurge. Come after a night out of drinking and it'll be even better. Drinks are expensive, but the food is on the cheaper side. Paid $40 for soda and dinner for two, plus a 27% tip. Definitely will be back.

QBl86x6_D4hQj6XPxKFRzA.text: This was my first time trying authentic noodles and it was really good. It is a cozy not so big.  restaurant with a decent menu. We weren't the only ones in the restaurant but came at good time it seemed to pick up as we were closer to finishing our meals. The server was alone and had to juggle all the tables so we did have a bit of a wait between her visits but they were frequent enough to not feel lost with the other groups. This is a place If you are new to noodles you should bring someone with you who knows the dishes. We spent alot of time looking up each ingredient as there were no translations on the menu. I ended up with a curry bowl and it was a bit on the heavy side with okay flavor. I also tried their miso soup which I love but it was a bit bland. Their drink menu was pretty much non existent there were only 2 kinds of sake. Overall it was an okay experience. I am a foodie so if someone said hey let's go here I would go again but it would not be a place I would pick oh my own.

BLNKnIqcKMyqhfcgI2nOQQ.text: This place has yet to disappoint! Found this place in February and seems to have me coming almost every week sometimes 2-3 days a week. Food is amazing definitely high quality Japanese comfort food. Service is quick and servers are kind and courteous.

t9P5ZnbPc3vj47dnNOXOsw.text: Pretty decent place for ramen, close to my house so it is convenient. Very cute place, nice and clean. Been here twice now and they changed their menu, added more appetizers. Service was not the best, they only had about 2 tables but we still waited for refill, server did not check on us.   They have a variety of ramen, fried rice, and appetizers. Got the spicy miso ramen and it was pretty good. Although the picture on the menu makes it look like you get 1 whole egg but you only get half... I love egg so I was sad when I only got half. Also takoyaki only comes in 4, other places usually come in 6 I believe. Tried their chasu buns which was weird, we expected slices of chasu but we got ground meat...nothing crazy flavorful. Also tried the kimchi pork belly bun which was ok.

wMoFH2-asEdL04WEWIrCtQ.text: Worst service we've experienced in years!   Almost left because it took too long to take our order.  Brings out the wrong poke bowl.  Forgets to bring my Miso soup.   Refills the water when our iced teas are empty.  Finally brings Miso after I ask for it, and hands it over my shoulder, from behind, reaching over their half wall! Wtf?!? Who does that with anything, much less a steaming cup of soup?!? And the poke bowl game out the second time with seaweed salad. Something we asked not to have.  Twice!   Only good thing was my wife's Ramen, the spicy tonkotsu miso.

jh5pcfaK9GPr7Y5oXcNl4g.text: Bun was not soft like how they should be. Chicken curry was great and the ramen was delish. Prices are AWESOME!!! Cool vibe inside too. Great service.

qWy4I1ljAUCHeKE7Buql6w.text: Finally I don't have to drive to Chinatown, definitely excited about a ramen place opening on the Southwest part of town.  My fiance ordered the spicy tonkotsu and it had the right amount of flavor to it.  I wish the karraage was a little more crispy, but that's a personal preference to me.   I ordered the katsu don,  once again not bad, just wish there was more flavor in the pork and rice so I just asked for hot sauce.  The part I dislike is that there are no descriptions or images, so we had to ask the server to explain things on the menu.  Another suggestion, have Yelp help you (thanks to the previous reviews and photos !!!)  The atmosphere/decor was super cute.    This is the primary reason it got an extra star  (just being honest).   The servers are attentive.  The food was good.  I think they could kick it up a notch with the flavoring, but with everything else I would definitely come back !!

__mI6ZG4MxKM3R5mbLrtDQ.text: Came across this place driving from Henderson since Monta Chaya was a 45 min wait. Saw this on Rainbow Blvd and decided to stop here and try it.   Off the bat when walking in, the atmosphere was really nice. Had that Japan feel like eating at an alley of Japan which was a nice feeling! Even had a little noodle bar. Only thing is it was a little chilly I guess they didn't have the heater on, but eating Ramen would warm me up in no time!   For appetizer I ordered the Tuna Sashimi ($10) which took a little time to get to me. It tasted fresh and not stringy at all like some tunas would. Was so creamy and had 3 different kind of seaweeds. Was quite interesting especially the clear looking one. It was yummy.   For Ramen I got the Tonkoysu Miso ($7.75) with toppings of Nori ($.75), and Egg ($1.50). As I was waiting for my order, I totally forgot to add the butter, but once I tasted my ramen, it was so yummy and buttery already and didn't need it anymore. It was so tasteful and yet so light. It came with the usual veggies/bamboo shoots and chashu. Although I didn't taste much garlic which I love with ramen.  Hubby and son ordered the Ton Katsu Curry Don. ($10.00) came with a side salad with ginger dressing and miso soup. The curry and chicken together was such a good flavor and perfect spiciness. By this time nothing can go wrong with the food. Everything was delicious.   Why only 3 stars? Well the food took more time to come out than other usual ramen places. We also had ordered 3 pork buns as appetizer, but never came out and had to cancel the order since it was put on our bill. It was really chilly inside the restaurant even after eating my Ramen and being the fact that I had to eat with my jacket on was super uncomfortable. And lastly, for being an Izakaya, they didn't have much options on their menu as other Izakayas. Other than that, our server was great and super happy with all the food we got. Will definitely be back for more.

YnoXl7aGx9iBFvmgb30N0Q.text: awesome service and great tasting japanese food.... my new go to stop when craving japanese food

HNQIlB8aJKPa2KQfUM5bLA.text: I came here on opening day unknowingly and at the time, you could tell they just opened.  I walked in and it seemed really established. The furniture was new and they designed the restaurant well with Japanese themed decorations. The menu is fairly simple, but if you aren't familiar with Japanese dishes, then it could be a challenge. I knew most of the items on the menu, but it seemed to have some duplications so I asked about them. The waitress half answered my question with no confidence until she asked her manager and even with the manager's answer, I didn't buy it. I still don't know the difference between the katsu don and tonkatsu don. Then I just asked about a few more items and she had to continue going back and asking about them. I know she will learn in time, but I thought knowledge of items would be something that would be well covered before opening. As long as she learns, I don't mind.  The food was nothing spectacular, just up to par for Japanese food. Their onigiri was not that great at all. I got the beef and bonito onigiri and I wouldn't order them here again honestly unless a lot of time has passed. I ordered the chicken karaage bowl and it comes with a salad and soup. They forgot my soup and when I told them I was missing my soup, it didn't come out very hot, so that was a red flag for me. My mom ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen and it wasn't spicy at all. The noodles and everything else in it was ok, but nothing spectacular.  I see major potential for this place and can help fulfill the missing Japanese food niche in Vegas. They had a lot of hiccups opening day, but things can turn around really easily.

KShPXFeCtP2-bFHE4Q1qsQ.text: Worst Service hands down. The food is decent but after today we will never be back again. There has never been a time that we came here and felt like we received decent service yet we always attempt to give them another chance. After waiting 8 minutes for a server to even approach us we had to ask him to take our drink order since clearly he didn't think we needed drinks with our food.   The food came out in the most random times. We are a family of 5 with 3 children. Our food came out first and we had to wait about another 12 minutes for our kids to get their food. By then our food was cold but we didn't want to ruin our dinner by complaining. No one bothered checking on us and we didn't get 1 refill till the end of our meals.   The place wasn't packed so I couldn't figure out why they couldn't check in on their guest. I would have walked away without taking the time to write this review but what  happened when I went to pay for my bill is what truly lead me to leave this post. We have eaten here many times before and typically order the same dishes. When I got the bill I handed him my card and when I went to write in the gratuity I noticed that there was already a 18% gratuity that was automatically added. When I asked the server if they charge auto gratuity he said yes for a party of 5. I then looked at the menu, looked at the signage around the store and found nothing that informs customers that an auto gratuity would be applied to their bills. Considering the fact that this wasn't our first time here this came unexpected. I understand that those who work in the top industry work hard to make tips. I understand the policy of auto gratuity what I don't understand is why there was no signage and why we were not informed of this policy. Not only did we receive horrible service which was practically no service at all I am forced to pay auto gratuity without knowledge and without the servers actually putting in work for it.   This is extremely unprofessional and management should inform their customers on this new policy and post this information on their menus like everyone else does when auto gratuity is required. This place needs new management, new employees, and should learn how to provide service since that is in fact the sole purpose of their restaurant business.

7TK9BYJCDGXLX1Urp56F9Q.text: I'm so glad I was finally able to try Omoide after driving past it for years. It's a shame, actually. I could have been enjoying their food this entire time.    I'm a wannabe connoisseur of tonkatsu ramen. I've been trying to sample it from every ramen house in the valley. Omoide has landed very high on my list. At $8, it's one of the best values of ramen available. The broth was thick and creamy, salt content was good. The noodles had that slight dense chew, which I like. Chashu was melt-in-your-mouth as it should be. Tamago (egg) was perfectly seasoned with a perfect custard-like yolk, nice portions of bamboo shoots, mushroom, and green onion. No bean sprouts which I'm totally okay with. I would rank them in my top 3 for sure.   Their menu is a great value all around. Their mini chashu bowl was $4 and came with a generous serving of chashu, perfect for a kids meal. The regular size poke bowl was pretty big, I don't know who would need a large. Low prices, high quality, big portions, absolutely exceptional.

D3UQpQLkL0OOArM3nRouQA.text: We came here with a good sized party for our family reunion. I wanna say about 18-25 people were there.   They have a lunch special Monday - Friday. You have a choice of either Udon or Ramen and then a choice of chashu bowl, mini curry or mini fried rice, plus a soda for $12! What a deal!   Downside, when we ordered this special for my kids (aged 8 and 6) they don't have any juice options or they wouldn't substitute a calpico drink for the soda, as we don't give or allow our kids to have soda.   My husband ordered their special which was a spicy short rib ramen ($12). When it arrived there were 2 bones with both fairly a decent amount of beef on the bone. The beef was soft and tender. The broth had just enough spice, but enough to make my husband's nose start running.   With the amount of people we had in our party, the food and service was pretty on point.   I would definitely come back here again!

CiyWVqbRkYdeJvIAQWvkAA.text: One of the best Japanese food places I've been in LV! I was looking for some Japanese food close by and found Omoide, which was also recommended to me by someone else.  First thing, the outside of the restaurant catches your eye and so does the interior, it's unique and up my alley, love the overall vibes!  When I got the menu, I was so surprised by how many choices they had. But what I get is always limited, katsudon, curry katsu, or ramen. Because I was craving katsudon more, I got that and we also ordered the curry katsu and spicy tonkotsu ramen. Also an order of karaage chicken. Prices I believe  are all about $10 and up, but the portions are pretty big.  Loved the presentation of the foods. So first the karaage chicken isn't that crispy on the outside, but it's still pretty good and it's seasoned well. The curry and tonkatsu was really good too. The curry here is a bit more flavorful and a bit sweeter than zen curry, so I prefer the curry here compared to there. The katsudon is also good, but wouldn't order it next time. It didn't have a lot of sauce which would've moistened and seasoned the rice a bit and not a lot of onions or egg as I thought. The spicy tonkotsu ramen was bomb! Not that spicy as I thought, noodles on point, just loved it. It tasted a little korean in my opinion, but anyways really good. Totally would order that again.  Definitely one of the best Japanese restaurants I've tried that isn't an AYCE. Coming back next time!

Could be ingredients or just quality but even the soba I ordered today had an off taste that soba shouldn't have. I ate most of it because I was hungry and didn't want to wait. RjEQNNizPj5Kz5jEwd157A.text: I noticed they've had a food challenge, so I decided to come in this store to gather some Intel.     When you walk in the restaurant, the place looks like a little farmers market.  I love the atmosphere, it's really unique. I've never seen anything like it so far in Vegas.  Just know if you decide to come eat here, you'll end up taking pictures of their decorations.  I should mention, it did take a while for service to reach our table.  Even though the store wasn't busy when we visited the store, It still took a while for a server to come to our table.  This left me feeling uneasy about the quality of food we'd receive from them.    I've ordered the King Tonkatsu, the server said the challenge will consist of 3 orders of this and also 2 rice bowls.  In order to see what challenges lie in front of me, I decided to sample something similar to the challenge.  The dish is served with a giant slab of tonkatsu and a little bowl of rice.  Alongside some veggies and sauce for the tonkatsu.  I was able to finish the plate, but the flavor wasn't there.  I feel as though they've focused more on making a quantity, but lost the flavor along the way.    Overall, I don't think I can take on the challenge.  It's hard to consume food that won't help me consume it.  Maybe another time I'll revisit the store for their Ramen instead.

SWBqVLcf_C9gKihdbAiadg.text: I have been here a few times during lunch, which I feel is the perfect time to go. It is not very busy and the lunch special is great!  Lunch special consists of a bowl of ramen, salad, and a rice bowl. All that and a drink for a pretty good price! I haven't been for dinner, but I can imagine it can get busy pretty quickly. The restaurant is not that big and parking lot is also small.  The interior design also makes this place so fun. You feel as if you are in an alley in Japan eating street food because of how the decorations are. I think it sets the mood and makes it feel even more authentic, lol.  There are other options besides noodle bowls that I haven't tried, but given what I have eaten, everything has been delicious and well cooked. It is a little warm in the restaurant, so that combined with warm soup does make it a little uncomfortable later. I was sweating at the end while eating soup, but it was delicious. And they have Onigiri here, which I have always been wanting to try.

umaxOl5Os3EvosXSG1vQoQ.text: All ramen places need cool Asian decor but only if the ramen tastes good.  And Omoide hits the spot, the lanterns up top is my favorite oh oh and the wooden shoes.  I've been here multiple times now but I used to drive past this place just to eat at a korean bbq place further down the street.  I'm glad I stopped by.  Not too many ramen places have honey toasts or poke bowl options on their menu!    Servers here are alright, they're not always on top of things but at least they take the time to explain or describe the items on the menu to you.  Make sure you listen too because they have cold noodles here and I don't want you to order thinking what you're getting is ramen but it's cold soba instead.

UOPQNCSQa9uH9JxTEwrgpw.text: I have been going to Omoide since they opened, and it just gets better  each time!  Omoide knows how to stay relevant amidst competition and different food trends.  I hadn't been in a while and was pleasantly surprised to see Japanese style pasta offerings, LA style poke (didn't know there was such a thing), and honey toast!  Oh honey!! :)  Highlights:  The mentaiko pasta was soooo delicious!  You can choose between ramen or udon noodles.  I got it with ramen noodles that were cooked to al dente perfection!  It had a slightly salty, spicy, and light, creamy flavor.  I think I could have eaten a second order, it was that good!  If the cod roe scares you, do not fear.  The roe is blended into the sauce so you don't even see it.    Grilled shishito peppers - Perfect appetizer!  Sprinkle some lemon juice and you can eat these peppers like they were a bag of chips!  Awesome lunch special!  Choice of ramen or udon with a side of a rice dish (grilled pork belly on rice, curry, or fried rice), and a soft drink for $12!!  The portions are all regular sized portions too!!  A Little Lowlight:  The kimchi pork bao was underwhelming.  Maybe it was because I could see the chefs using a microwave, and the pork had some lukewarm/cold spots here and there...  This little hiccup won't stop me from coming back here though. I think next time, I would order the grilled pork belly bao and give them baos another try.  The staff here has always been great!  Maybe one day I will take on the King Tonkatsu challenge!!

9q0g6pmelqqn9cPKt3ns7w.text: Not a bad choice for a quick Asian meal.  This is a popular place, and it's not that big inside. So, you might have wait at peak times.   The interior has a cool rustic Asian decor, and the staff were very friendly.   They have a modest sized menu with some popular mainstream Asian dishes.   We tried the potato croquettes and chicken karage to start. Both were very good. The croquettes were perfect with a crunchy exterior and a soft, warm interior of delicious potato filling. The karage was similarly good. It was high quality meat (breast I think) unlike the cheap mystery meat you get at lesser establishments. It was lightly fried and crispy without tasting too greasy. Very good!  I went for the katsu which is a classic favorite. It was not quite Saboten, but it was quite good. Tender though not exactly "cut it with a fork" meat with a crunchy coating that was not overly greasy or oily. It was served with a small salad and miso soup which were both fine though nothing spectacular.

P3HpoBm8nIMIrPJs9vYGpg.text: This is a nice little local spot. Casual atmosphere, music at a good level, and attentive service. We started with Pumpkin Croquettes and Tako Yaki appetizers. Tako Yaki is a ball of fried octopus, and it was perfectly cooked and drizzled with a tasty sauce. The pumpkin croquettes were different, but no complaints at the table. It was sweet and savory, and fried so how could you go wrong?  The Udon Shrimp Tempura was served boiling hot, with two large pieces of tempura shrimp. Could have used a larger portion of Udon noodles, but the flavor was on point. A friend had the Katsu Don, a large portion of breaded chicken over rice, served with salad, pickled veggies and miso soup. The plate was empty so I assume he enjoyed it! Finally we tried the Honey Toast, (I try honey toast every time I see it on a menu.) It was good. That's all I can say. Not spectacular, not bad at all. The side of black sesame ice cream tasted like it had spent too long in the freezer, probably not popular enough to sell through regularly.  I'd try it again if I was going to eat with a friend or group, and was looking for a quick, hot lunch.

-Mz5Ni63BZ52o5OGloswvw.text: My fiance and I were in the mood for some Japanese food and decided to come here as it comes highly recommended from a good friend. We stopped in about 8pm on Saturday night - the place was busy, but we were seated immediately. That's where the goodness ends.   We looked at the menus for a while - long enough for the people who came in behind us to be seated, get drinks and food. No one had come by to get our drink orders or even check us. Of course, I understand being busy, but at the very least any type of issue should have been communicated to us.   After discussing how rude and unprofessional this is, we  decided to leave. If you can't be bothered with taking care of your customers and making them all feel welcome, we can't be bothered with dining at your establishment or recommending it to anyone. The salmon melted in my mouth and the avocado was perfectly ripe. I also ordered a Katsu pork bun. It was bigger than I thought it would be and was also taster than I thought it would be. Lastly, of course we had to order the Honey Toast and we ordered it with black sesame ice cream although the waitress kept saying not to, and to order it with Vanilla ice cream instead. Welp, no we wanted black sesame AND guess what miss waitress it tasted like an orgasm in my mouth. The black sesame ice cream was delish, and that toast! My goodness soo goddam good. Order the Honey Toast even if your full. Because my friends its worth it.

iI8_UTfM_X-z954EDG49GQ.text: Spicy tonkotsu miso ramen, with corn, for the both of us, along with some garlic edamame. The edamame seems standard and very similar to the one at Bachi Burger (this isn't a complaint, as I very much enjoyed it). I'm not gonna lie, I never eat the chashu, so I don't even feel qualified to give an opinion. Sometimes when you order miso ramen, it comes out with a very thick broth, which I am not a fan of. This did not happen at Omoide, however. It was a good balance of spice and miso.  The decor here is very, very cute. The servers are nice and attentive. I hope Omoide does well because I'm interested in trying the other offerings!

t4d-NN1Rn-6kORkhcMLpMA.text: The best katsu in southwest Las Vegas between 10 - 11pm!!!  We stopped in to Omioide and went with the waitress's recommendations, Tonkatsu Ramen, Katsu Don, Konbu Onigiri, and Pumkin Croquette. Aside from the raw egg white on the Katsu Don everything was palatable...then again most places aren't going merely for palatable food options. We didn't hate any items we tried...but we would certainly rather venture elsewhere. The ramen lacked flavor, and I literally thought on first bite, "Well, this is edible." My favorite item was the Pumkin Croquette, but even here; this isn't something I could ever envision myself specifically wanting to stop in to Omioide to get. All around they are a strong two star or very weak three stars. The problem is that with the exception of ramen most of their menu can be found nearby at a similar price point with much better versions. ...and for ramen I'd rather make the trip to Flamingo or Spring Mountain than come back. It sounds a little harsh, but the food certainly wasn't A-OK...it was precisely, "Meh. I've experienced better."  It's hard to recommend an item that was served with unintended raw egg, but if you find your way here, I think I would go with the Katsu Don to go with the aforementioned Pumkin Croquette. Omioide took over the old Rice Trax building and fans of that quality & originality of food may enjoy themselves here.   The interior is more than adequate for this price range and we actually really like the padded double-chair/loveseat-chairs. They were comfortable and certainly something you don't typically find. While we didn't particularly relish anything, Omioide seems like the kind of place that will do okay in this part of town with teenagers, twenty-something's, and individuals that don't seek out great food.

Cv0FJY4R5X7duVREQYm3Yg.text: Amazing spot, super healthy but still very tasty.  Even the lychee beer is delicious. The Nigori Strawberry  sake is sweet & delicious, it tastes almost like  milk shake .

I'd rather wait 45 minutes at Monta to get seated and eat some good ramen.   The kitchen was so backed up. They brought one of the appetizers we ordered and it was wrong so I sent it back. They gave us a complimentary vegetable tempura for the messed up. I kept on hearing the servers apologizing for their kitchen being backed up but yet the servers couldn't keep up cleaning the tables, waiting on the tables, and serving the customers which I didn't understand when there's 5 of them and since there's no food coming out of the kitchen. Our ramen finally came out 25 minutes later but we still never got the wrong appetizer that I had sent back and the other appetizer we have ordered. 7qwScVe3acXPTkXW-H3gcQ.text: Omoide had a really nice atmosphere and looks much different from other Japanese Restaurants I've been.  They have the usual ramen counter, but it's quite a small section.  At first I thought the name meant 'Heavy' since Omoi means Heavy in Japanese, but when I saw the word Omoide in kanji I realized it means likes to Reminisce or to remember memories.  They have a variety of food to choose from: Udon, Ramen, Gyuudon (Meat Bowl), etc.  My friends and I chose this place to try their ramen. The last time I went, I saw that they also have Poke Bowls which was new to me since the last time I went to Omoide.  I had the Tonkatsu Miso while my other friends had the regular Tonkatsu. The ramen had the usual meat, bamboo, and seaweed.  It also consist of thin type of noodles.  Overall, it was delicious~  It tasted similar to other Ramen restaurants I've been too.  It was a nice experience, would go again to try out their other foods~

We did have a few questions about some foods because the menu didn't really explain what some of the dishes contained.   One of our friends asked if he could try their curry sauce and the waitress looked confused about why he wanted to taste it. He had to explain that he wanted to taste it so he could decide whether he would choose a dish that contained the curry and she just nodded left and came back a few minutes later with the curry. The curry was watery and not as thick as other restaurants make it.  My husband and I got the takoyaki, salmon avocado salad, and Ebi fry don. The Ebi fry was okay. It was kind of chewy and may have been fried a little too much. The salmon was good and the takoyaki was okay.   As we ended our meal the waitress took her time to come to us and hand us our bills. This was a change from her rushing us and I personally didn't like how much of a difference her attitude changed from the beginning of our meal to the end.
