t_chKnhQuaaLLRlr1dzFeA.text: Omoide means "memory" in Japanese. The restaurant is CUTE. I wouldn't say it's very Japanese, but it's a good and cute attempt. Definitely kawaii.  Why the low reviews, Yelp? The 2 dishes I tried were both good. There aren't very many non-sushi Japanese restaurants in Vegas, but this one makes up for it. Authentic items on the menu, but they didn't taste authentic. But that doesn't mean they didn't taste good.  Chashu bowl: Fatty pork, but that melt in your mouth kind of fat. Not the chewy stuck in your mouth kind of fat. Heavily flavored and dripping sauce into the rice. A plus.  Ebi-don. Oyako-don, but with tempura shrimp instead of chicken. They don't usually serve it with tempura shrimp in Japan, but I can see the appeal.Very filling. Both dishes came with a salad, soup and pickled veggies.  They have a lunch special where you can order a noodle and rice dish with a soda. Super cheap and an easy carry out too!

vVmPIph3hJscVvaimJoyMQ.text: King Katsu for $30 worth it! Tasty curry , yummy rice balls & affordable bento for lunch. I wasn't feeling the ramen noodles. Flavor , ingredients , ramen broth good. Just didn't have that al dente noodle bite. Some people prefer the type of ramen noodles they use.

Ulth6TG2bUVwrjiZKQ2XIg.text: Last time I was here was about 1.5-2 years ago. Ordered ramen but was not impressed with it (if you scroll down through the comments you'll see similar reviews from when they first opened).   Was very craving ramen tonight and this was the only place open after 11 pm in the area. I Gave it another shot. Wow, what an improvement! I don't know if they changed chef or something, it was really good.   Ramen was al dente, egg was perfect, compliments all flavorful. The soup is definitely lighter than Monta's and less salty. Which I don't think is a bad thing at all. Just different styles.   Think this will be my new midnight spot after work. I'll try a few more things and update my review.  I know that they got hit hard with some low star reviews from the beginning. Giving five stars to help bring their average up.

58V9cfu_77p59t-8cdwF6w.text: On Las Vegas rare snowy day called for a warm bowl of Ramen. This is our 2nd time to Omoide Noodles & Bowls. We typically go to a different Ramen joint but we liked that this location had tuna sashimi. Tonight we saw they had Tuna Tataki. According to the menu it looked like seared tuna, so we decided to switch it up and try the Tuna Tataki because the picture on the menu made it look delicious. Upon receiving the Tuna Tataki it looked nothing like the picture. I have attached a collage of what we received, what the menu showed it was, and what the menu showed Beef Tataki was. The item we received looked more like Beef Tataki and nothing like Tuna Tataki from the menu. Needless to say we should have stuck to normal Tuna Sashimi & won't even get Tuna Tataki again. I asked our waiter if they gave us beef Tataki on accident since it looked more like that and nothing like Tuna Tataki on the menu. He apologized and told me that they typically tell customers that they put the sauce on the ahi and not on the side. I also asked if it was suppose to have black pepper crust and he said typically it does. He agreed that basically it was False advertisement because the Tuna Tataki looked nothing like what it was advertised as. Customer service was good but Very disappointed with the quality of the food & False advertisement.

IagTW7qZbfG1WvXi9NdV8w.text: This review is long overdue. I love this cute little Japanese restaurant. The servers have been great every time I visit (since 2016). Their ramen is the best in my opinion in comparison to Jinya, Monta, Sora, and other places I've tried. The karaage chicken is the bomb - perfectly seasoned and fried to the right texture and crunchiness. The tempura is battered light and airy; yet it has that perfect crunchiness and real simple taste (clean and non-oily or greasy frying). I once ordered their misoyaki butterfish (black cod), but I wasn't too impressed. I used to eat at a Japanese restaurant in Hawaii that employed highly trained Japanese chefs from Japan so I think I got spoiled from that. Because of those great Japanese chefs, I know good Japanese food when I taste it.

A9r2aS5S-9yered7z0wYaw.text: Not the richest best tasting ramen I've had, but I did quite enjoy it! I ordered the lunch special with pork ramen and pork chashu bowl. I ordered them plain and was quite happy with it. The noodles had a nice chew, the soup was a think milky consistency. The pork bowl had a savery  sweet flavor and quite a bit of pork. We also ordered the chicken, which was very flavorful and tasty.   I suggest trying this place.

CqDdY_ffJuMp0vqTW4eBbQ.text: Omoide means dream in Japanese.  Our large group rotated in on a Sunday afternoon after a long holiday weekend of rock climbing. We appreciated the warmth, especially the extra warm restrooms, that gave flashbacks to the warm heated toilet seats in Japan. These toilet seats weren't heated but the adorable little bathroom space was extra warm and cozy.  This ramen shop was conveniently located off the freeway on the drive back to Southern California. Our group arrived and departed in staggered times which probably made it easier for the restaurant to manage.   There were vegetarian options for those that didn't eat meat and they were still hearty, warm and satisfying ramen. The majority of the party ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen and added an egg. Some people didn't get eggs as the kitchen ran out but we weren't charged for them.   A big thumbs up for the service that tried their best to accommodate our group.

The menu has plenty of food to choose from  usually order the Tonkatsu Shoyu (my FAV) and every time I order it I fall in love.  Most of the time I go and dine here the waitresses are such a delight. It's simple, but don't expect the best tasting broth or quality. It's not bad tasting, but it's not the greatest. Their pricing is around the same as other places near by, so you'll look to spend around $8-$13 per entree. I only tried their katsu and ramen here. I actually thought the katsu was pretty good! It was pretty plain and they charge you extra for everything while at the other ramen places it's included. The positive thing is this place is open late that's what attracted us to go to it.

CPZ0oERr1QQnVC5NDmM_fA.text: This place is okay. I pass by this place on my way to work so I thought 'Oh cool, a place that my boyfriend and I can try!'  Honestly, their stuff is a little overpriced... $2 for one rice ball? That's kind of ridiculous. The soup I expected to be about $9-$10, but the flavor wasn't all that great. We ordered takoyaki which is so much better at Ramen Tatsu. Something about the flavor was kind of off. I got the spicy tonkotsu miso and my boyfriend got the spicy tonkotsu. His soup was grainy... My noodles were really mushy. We don't like to complain when we're hungry, so I'm just warning you all out there that honestly, there's better choices out there. I'm glad I tried it because I can say that I'll be heading back over to Monta or Ramen Sora instead. It's a shame because I really wanted to like you guys. I do like that you guys offer a variety of food options, but the prices are definitely a turn off. *sad face*

9_TR7O3C6mIU3Y9aBFfA0Q.text: We get take out from here a great deal and we have never been disappointed. The noodles are authentic and they give you a nice selection to choose from. Our son loves ramen but he has become used to the packaged bowls - this place has helped him develop his palette and be more adventurous. No complaints with the 'to go' service.

d3DMkGJTGCTzW--hbKSR9w.text: The food is OK but that's it it's just OK. Staff was super nice but the food for the price, I'll never return.  If they were even just a couple dollars cheaper on their entrees that might make a difference but for what you're getting and the price for pain it just is no value to it.

bYdxNP1p-qAW6l9r81VciA.text: This place just opened up and is exactly what this area needed! I had the tonkotsu shoyu ramen and added corn and egg to it. Amazing! I would have taken a photo, but devoured the bowl before I thought about it. Will be back very often!

lzvaxxLMTq0FNmmnm2pHoA.text: Spicy ramen was to die for love this place. Keep up the good work guys. You won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Omoide Noodles & Bowls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing nuff said

C1MikZBp1JmE7ZoRkSkzzA.text: This place I thought would be awesome like the Udon spot in Hawaii, but come to find out very disappointing.   The reason why I say this is because the udon is not thick. It is pretty skinny for udon and also the meat portion on it is a joke. I ordered the curry broth which was very good actually, but it came with pork belly that was 3 small pieces. It was literally small as a strip of super thin bacon sliced into 3 pieces.   The decor was on point and service. Just need to work on giving a little bit more meat in the portions.

oDs5NOET80z-B2JWsNcBWw.text: I really liked this place.  The ramen was good and it's close to my place.  Haven't had a bad ramen place though.

oKoHP45vTLLkYAZXLwIdog.text: This place rocks!  I will definitely be a regular with it being right down the street. I had two things: Pumpkin Croquette and Spicy Tonakatsu Miso Ramen.    Spicy Tonakatsu Miso: Full of flavor, spicy but not too spicy, ground meat and great noodles!  Pumpkin Croquettes: AMAZING! Two come in the order.  Nice thin crisp panko crust with sweet and savory pumpkin inside.  I could have eaten twenty of these things.

hI9wjIcruDK7sWO2l58grQ.text: finally a ramen place in SW, no need to drive to China town, try the tonkotsu ramen, it is okay, nothing spectacular, service on par

photos.caption: Photo of Omoide Noodles & Bowls - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YibhIfjJMXYUnRD8CPP_aw.text: I really liked the place.  It was cute and decorated up like a streetcorner.  Our food arrived quickly and was delicious.  I was disappointed there were few veggies in the ramen but the flavor was fantastic (lack of veggies cost one star).  Price was on-point and affordable.  Service was quick.  I would recommend this restaurant to others who want a quick bite at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Omoide Noodles & Bowls - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nom nom

2akD6j9oEM4P5qPIQzRNQA.text: Chilly night so decided to get some ramen here. Ordered just shoyu ramen and potato croquette which was good. For vegas locals, this is the old Rice Trax location. Atmosphere was okay, service was okay but they have to change the music. They had some sort of rave music going, not quite matched to the atmosphere. I would probably dine there again.

tpS_-gwrYn_2gE_CWuJrGw.text: The good: perfectly cooked egg, tasty pork broth, chasu.  The bad: imperfect rice texture/flavor. No liquor license but won't allow byob/w.  Below average tempura.  The Japanese typos on the menu (our Japanese friends were laughing and cringing at the same time) obviously not designed by a native speaker of Japanese.   So much promise but missing conviction and follow through.

jXRi0qMCNWrveNifzuVg3w.text: Just came in for lunch and boy oh boy was it amazing!!! Lunch special was $12 for a full bowl of ramen, salad, side dish and drink (I got the iced green tea - which was made from macha, so good). The decor was like stepping into a little noodle house in Tokyo. I loved it and will be back to try more!!

kqy2LBn-VsEWWuwXw_NwVg.text: We had a very strange experience here. There seemed to be a little bit of a language barrier although she was really nice. The appetizers were ok, the only huge complaint I have was the broth in the actual soup. It was so bland and flavorless. It definitely needs to be spruced up: I ordered the shrimp tempera soup and the shrimp was placed on top of the soup so by the time you eat the shrimp they are completely soggy and ruined. The music and ambiance was cool but the lights needed to be slightly dimmed. If they would work on the flavor of the soup we might consider coming back.

oRZtlg63ygxWCpR20I3Pdw.text: I'm always looking for a late night restaurant and this one fits the bill open till 1 am on most nights.  I love the curry bowl and the curry noodle bowl with pork belly.  The menu now includes the ever popular poke bowl with some nice options at a reasonable price.  The atmosphere is upbeat and the decor is fun.

ciYP2C14pe1J0PoDDLz3dA.text: Awesome place! It's so nicely decorated inside, and a very friendly server. The food was great!

TQBTNEPq0_q_hjyz4KiFQw.text: Food was good but check your receipts.  When the check came, it wasn't itemized. When my husband asked for a copy he noticed the gratuity was already added. He then said, "Oh, I didn't know the gratuity was already added."  The cashier said, "You didn't ask."  Walked back to the table and removed what would've been an extra tip. This place would've gotten five stars if they didn't try to pull a fast one on us. And no it was not posted anywhere that gratuity is automatically added.

-2NvgX9BFknnMMWEsB2BIA.text: Such a cute little restaurant! Great food and a decent price. It's my new favorite noodle spot

MXa9DyKLWU8EgPANrXsuMQ.text: The restaurant has a cool decor/setup. Also, the waitress' are very friendly & helpful. I got the Shrimp Tempura Udon and a side of Mixed Veggie Tempura.
